publicationStmt.p: This is an XML-TEI markup of the original publications by SIL Mexico for the purposes of: archival and for the creation of a body of Mixtepec-Mixtec language resources (LR) (ISO: mix). Encoded documents used with the permission of original authors.

notesStmt.note: En este pequeño libro se describen las épocas principales del año y el trabajo que se hace en el campo durante cada época. También se mencionan las frutas, verduras y hierbas que se cosechan en cada época.

sourceDesc.bibl: Kue chuun ña yee nii kuia nuu ñoo Beckmann, Gisela(consultant); Nieves, María M.(consultant). 2009. (2nd ed.). Instituto Lingüístico de Verano, A.C. Tlalpan, D.F., México Obtained from:

abstract.ab: En este pequeño libro se describen las épocas principales del año y el trabajo que se hace en el campo durante cada época. También se mencionan las frutas, verduras y hierbas que se cosechan en cada época.

textDesc.channel: @mode:'w' means that the primary means of utilising this document is by reading it's written form;
textDesc.derivation: this document is labeled "original" because the XML-TEI markup of it's contents have not made any alterations to the original content;

elementSpec.desc: Where the page divisions in the original documents are, this encoding uses "div" (division) elements; this is to separate the linguistic, and knowledge data from formatting

spanGrp.span: Dry season
The dry season is from February to April.
It doesn't rain, it's very windy and it's very hot.
And so they plant cilantro, garlic, carrots, yams, onion, lettuce, gourds, limes, oranges, tomatoes,....
Additionally, they also grow herbs that people eat like herbs, mint, (tayoo - type of herb), (yua tikumi - type of herb), and mustard.
People begin their work like this:
La gente empiezan su trabajo así:
They water the earth and then they wait about fifteen days.
They make ditches with a bull or make marks(?).
They water the crops or sew cilantro, or seeds for other crops that people eat.
crops
They water (the crops) and stop when the rains begin.

And in the dry season they water the crops, (when?) the rains come, they chop and collect corn and they prepare the earth for them to water the corn field, and then around March to April they began to till the earth and then dig ditches to water the crops.
The rain season is from May until September.
These months it rains a lot.
The grasses grow very well and the weeds grow back.
In the rainy season there are a lot of fruits and plants that people eat.
The people give a lot of water to the crops (?), pull weeds, and then put the crops in the ground.
And then they (?) again, sew black bean and (?) beans.
squash
pumkin
Cold Season
Winter
Winter/cold season is from October until January
It doesn't rain.
It (everybody?) is very cold in the early morning.
Some days ice falls.
The people harvest the crops.
They eat corn and then they store it away.
They (hit) the beans, they collect the dry parts of the corn plants and the donkeys, cows, and sheep eat it.
